sourcing.instructions: Co: Purchase from a chemical supplier (e.g., Sigma-Aldrich). Nd: Obtain from rare earth metal suppliers. P: Available from chemical supply stores. Tb: Source from rare earth metal suppliers. Zr: Purchase from metal alloy suppliers.
steps: Co: Purchase from a chemical supplier (e.g., Sigma-Aldrich). Nd: Obtain from rare earth metal suppliers. P: Available from chemical supply stores. Tb: Source from rare earth metal suppliers. Zr: Purchase from metal alloy suppliers.

1. Weigh out each ingredient using an analytical balance for accuracy. 2. Combine Co, Nd, P, Tb, and Zr in a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to grind the mixture until a uniform powder is achieved. 4. Transfer the powder into a suitable crucible for heating.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out each ingredient using an analytical balance for accuracy. 2. Combine Co, Nd, P, Tb, and Zr in a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to grind the mixture until a uniform powder is achieved. 4. Transfer the powder into a suitable crucible for heating.

steps: 1. Place the crucible in a high-temperature furnace. 2. Heat the mixture to 1200°C at a rate of 10°C per minute. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and homogeneity.
heating.raw_text: 1. Place the crucible in a high-temperature furnace. 2. Heat the mixture to 1200°C at a rate of 10°C per minute. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and homogeneity.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 25°C). 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled completely to prevent oxidation of the material.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 25°C). 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled completely to prevent oxidation of the material.

steps: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible once cooled. 2. Use a grinder to shape the sample to dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges and surface to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible once cooled. 2. Use a grinder to shape the sample to dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges and surface to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability.
